comment: Based on recent reviews I never should have taken this class. No study guides for test, no formula sheet, too many papers, and very hard to understand. He also just gave us another math topic to learn 4 days before a big test over 8 SECTIONS. So not only did I have to try n learn the new math but go back over the math we already learned. No time.

half of the class dropped the class and the exams are insanely difficult. expect to be a master of the content yourself, office hours are helpful do not take this class unless you have a lot of time or are naturally strong at math. not a good professor and grades are final with basically no extra credit

He is genuinely a nice guy, but not good at all at teaching calc. He made the concepts so difficult to understand. In every exam, the class average was failing. Homework was easy, and quizzes were sometimes ok, but other times awful. If it weren't for all the extra credit, I would have failed the class, and I already barely passed. Get a tutor.

drops homework and quizzes, but exams are hard and aren't covered by our materials well. I wish I didn't spend the money and the time to take his class because now im broke and going to take a loan to keep going with college. he gives extra credit but its incredibly small. his retake exams are even harder than the original exams.

I really think he's a charismatic guy, but his class is ridiculous. He's clearly passionate for the subject, and it's a horrible for those who just need to pass the class with a C. His lectures are… something, the homework is whatever, but the exams? The class averages were around 60, students can't succeed when they're failing out of the class.

Hes honestly a super nice guy and i enjoyed him as a person, but i have never done so bad in a class. Any form of math has always been my best subject but i have failed every exam in this class. The exams are way harder than the stuff we go over, which is already hard enough. If u take, good luck and definitely go to every class trust

He was a nice guy, but the tests are nothing like the given HW. He does not provide study guides. Weak teaching/explanation skills, making concepts seem extremely foreign and difficult. Most students do not do well in his class. Do not take.

He lectures like he expects all his students to instantly understand the material instead of us hearing it for the first time. I was always lost on what was happening during lecture, but if you study a bit outside of class each week you can catch up pretty easily. exams are not bad if you study
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: This guy writes his own reviews and his tests are nothing like the homework. He also offers not study guides. DO NOT TAKE
Does not offer study guides and tests are almost nothing like the homework. DO NOT TAKE.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Very thick accent. Friend recommended to me, wish I did my own research. If you're a math person you could take him, but if you just need to pass Calc I, DO NOT TAKE HIM. Homework is not easy and could take hours to complete. Exams are tough. He does WEEKLY quizzes. He does care for students but has high expectations.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Professor Valentin is knowledgeable and cares for his students but has high expectations. Be comfortable with precalculus, as he frequently uses it. The textbook may not be helpful, but clearer notes are provided. Take exams seriously, expect weekly quizzes, and use office hours. Homework is manageable if you grasp the concepts. MAKE FRIENDS!!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: He's a good professor. He doesn't hesitate to explain anything. He is lenient with grading tests and offers much extra credit. The class overall is pretty easy if you put in the effort. He also allows you to make up any exam you failed throughout the semester at the end of the semester. I never took pre-calculus and could pass the class with an A.

One of the worst professors I've ever taken. Incredibly rude and snarky when you ask questions (and unhelpful at that), will humiliate you in front of the class. Take literally anyone else. Tons of homework that aren't helpful to the quizzes and exams. Known for writing his own reviews so be wary of the positive ones. Nothing good to say about him.

very funny guy, but thick accent. if you're not already a math person, take someone else. the homework load is heavy and rarely has anything to do with the exam. attendance isn't mandatory but GO TO CLASS. he'll randomly do activities in class that will count for a grade but very little amount. he will let you do test corrections, DO THEM!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: He seems like a nice guy and cares, but his accent makes it tough to understand his lectures. The material is already difficult. He does not have good classroom management and distractions are a problem.

I will not recommend taking this class if you don't remember anything from pre-calculus. All of his lectures ain't going to help you for the test and exam. The only thing easy in this class is homework but, everything else is hard.

As long as you do not take him for an online class, and you do the work, you will pass. His tests are very easy compared to the lectures and homework, he gives you a skeleton of what questions are on the test before you take it so you know exactly what to study. His grading rubric can be extremely forgiving for even major mistakes.

If you're not a math major/math person, or if you're not on top of your algebra/trig, don't take this class. Lectures are very fast paced and he expects you to know your basics already. He does ask frequently if you understand the content and is very passionate. Be aware that notes are expected to be printed out and hand written. No laptops/phones.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Lecture heavy

comment: Attendance isn't mandatory, but GO TO CLASS! He gave some good extra credit that saved my grade from a C to a B. VERY tough grader, especially on tests. DO. THE. QUIZZES. IN. CLASS!!!

Very difficult to pass. Tons of homework that don't prepare you for the quizzes, which don't prepare you for the exams. At least he prepped you for the final exam with a study guide in the form of a series of extra credit. Extra credit is the only reason I passed, as I failed every exam, save for the final. He's nice and highly accessible, though.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework

comment: He allows visits during office hours and responds to emails in 10-20 minutes. He provides many resources like YouTube lectures and eBook problems, but I learned best from homework. Extra credit at semester's end helped me ace the class. Be prepared for a heavy workload and hours of preparation; as over 1/3 of the class dropped out of this class.

*Taken as an online class. The homework was tedious and wasn't super applicable to the exams but was still good practice. He provides guided notes with example problems from the textbook that do actually help with tests/quizzes. There was a ton of extra credit points at the end of the semester. Very fair grading system.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Please save yourself the trouble and DON'T take this class! Waste of time/money. This professor makes it almost impossible to pass. 1st day he assigned 8 pages of hw then gave us a test the next day. He marked answers I had gotten right as wrong on the 1st exam because I used a different method. Dropped his class after that. NOT a nice man.

Hard subject made harder by a lecturer who refuses to lecture. You're told to read a book's chapters so that you can do the homework and perform well on quizzes and tests. Well, the homework makes giant leaps of logic without teaching you about the leaps from the reading material. This makes for a frustrating time, leaving me unprepared for tests.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: This is the WORST professor I have ever met. He goes too fast and jumps from simple problems to nearly impossible ones. I took him first n then retook with another professor. I will say if you can get a different professor DO IT Otherwise you will basically be teaching yourself everything and struggling. Be aware he writes his own reviews on here!!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Worst teacher in my 20 years of existence, He was known by all his students to put his own ratings in to bump his RMP. He thought of us as people who knew calc rather than the students he had to teach. He would also stare at the girls in the class a little extra long, so beware. Best advice for an uprising KSU student: DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!!!

Overall very hard class but extra credit and lowest test grade being replaced by the final ultimately carried me through the class. Professor is very passionate about the subject and provides detailed lectures.

Homework is hard but test is easier than homework except for the application-based problems. He is very smart man but does not do a good job explaining things espically limits. He is a very tough grader and gives 5 questions so he isn't lenient with grading. If you are "supposed to know something" do not ask because he'll be upset.

I don't understand all the negative reviews about this guy. He's a charismatic and intelligent dude and he makes sure every student is caught up in the class. Gives out weekly quizzes which are great for learning the material (4 of the 11 quizzes are dropped), but fast-paced lectures. There's tons of extra credit so don't be scared of this class!

He cares and wants you to get a good grade but he can't do the work for you. he has weekly quizzes to ensure studying. has many resources to help with any confusion. holds office hours and is open to questions. he is very fast, however overall a great professor if you are willing to do the work.

This class itself is already tough; however, this is probably one of the few professors who want to actually help their students succeed. I definitely would recommend him. Beware that its homework and quizzes every week and a bit fast paced. You must come to class to keep up with the material.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: all the work was online, but tests in person. not very nice person. uses simplified methods during lecture. you'll probably need to watch tutorials to fully understand the material. began giving participation grades halfway through the semester.

He always asks if anyone has questions and encourages you to email him or go to his office hours if you don't understand. The worst part is the homework since it's really tedious, but that gets you ready for the test which really decides your grade so lock in for those.
Every problem he does in class seems very simple and then the homework is nothing like what was gone over in class. If you take him be prepared to read a lot of the textbook.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--So many papers

comment: good teacher. gave us lots of opportunities to get our grade up (11% total of extra credit) finished with a 89.4

I only had this professor for two days and that was enough for me. He said that he did not feel the need to teach us stuff we already knew and then dropped a packet on us to do for an hour 40 minutes. He did not even care to review one problem. He walked around class acting like he was doing something. DO NOT TAKE THIS TEACHER!!!
I only had this professor for two days and that was enough for me. He gave us a packet to do on

NEVER take this teacher. He gives so much homework and is so smart that he doesnt explain the simple steps. He also talks ab how many people fail his course and for some reason doesnt like people to have LAPTOPS OUT in class, so say hello to good old paper and pencil.  If you are reading this and want to be able to understand calc, DONT TAKE HIM

If someone could go back in time and tell me that this teacher would be this poor at teaching Calulus, I would have given them a Noble Piece prize. Please do not judge this teacher based on his ratings; he was infamously known this semester for putting his own ratings in an attempt to bring it up. Waste of your life to take this course
rating_tags: Tough grader--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: Do not become this professors project student. He will go on a power-trip if he doesn't like you. Go to his lectures, if you miss them constantly he won't like you. He also will just not give you points if your work is messy to him, even if your answer is correct on exams. Be almost condescendingly clear in your steps and explanation, and neat.

He really wants us to succeed. Though it was bumpy in the beginning and some of the ratings on RMP started to make sense. We eventually warmed up to him and the class became easier with time. He's really attentive and provides many resources to pass this class, and he genuinely doesn't want to fail you. I enjoyed this class and met many new people.

I thought he was a very good explainer, and he was good at explaining for the level of math that we took. Sometimes he would go beyond our experience level, but asking him to elaborate or telling him you don't understand helped a lot and he was able to explain is a better way

He is a professor who cares about your learning experience. Whenever he would go over a concept, he would ask the class if everyone is on the same page and pause for any questions that we have. There are times where he cracks jokes and he keeps that energy going in class.

One of my favorite proffesors so far. Make sure to ask questions if you are confused because that's the only way he'll know you need help. Overall hes very funny and a good teacher. He gives partial credit on tests so make sure to show your work so even if you don't get the question right he will see where you got the answer from!

Holy moly... Calc is a hard class no matter the professor, on the exception that the professor is too smart to teach limits! As the class goes further, the concepts become easier to understand and class isn't as bad. Homework is HARDER than in-class material. Make homework your difficulty standard, and that will make this class a breeze. Lock in.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: He is so funny and isn't afraid to admit he made a mistake. He frequently asks if you have questions and truly cares about students and their grades. His accent isn't hard to understand unless you've never heard a Hispanic person speak before, so don't let those reviews scare you.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Hilarious--Graded by few things

comment: Tries to teach everything so that students can understand the content, instead of only teaching what will be on the tests. Wants all of the students to pass and will provide opportunities for such. Goes pretty fast with lectures, but content is also in the textbook because he pulls his info straight from it.

I had this professor for MATH 2390 which was his first time teaching this class. The grading criteria was confusing and was never addressed in class. I would get points knocked off for things he never discussed and it was never consistent. Overall he doesnt want you to fail and he gives you many opportunities to fix your mistakes.

I honestly enjoyed this professor. He had guided notes that he filled out during class, meaning attendance is very important! He also gives a few points in extra credits on tests. If you use/fill out the notes, attend class, and do the homework, you will pass this class! He has a thick accent but all good.

Calc 2 isn't easy, but he made it bearable. Lectures can be a little confusing sometimes but he's available after class & happy to explain/help. No quizzes, and good extra credit (10q self-made study guide = 10 points on test) which helped a ton with grades. Partial credit on tests, no curve though. Would take again for calc 2 without a doubt.

He is a tough grader and doesn't offer a curve, and he gives a lot of homework. He also doesn't understand how to teach calculus in a way students can learn and understand. He also teaches really fast and skips over simple steps that are crucial to solving the problem. Don't take his class if you need to understand Calculus or make a good grade.

I took this class in the summer semester, so it was a little harder due to the fact we had less time to cover the same amount of material. The professor is pretty good. He goes over the topic thoroughly. He gives NO formula sheets, so if you do take him keep that in mind. However, he gives practice exams before the actual exams.

Professor Valentin would make a good neighbor, but he is not a good math teacher. He is so smart that it makes him poor for introducing ideas to beginners. His tests were extremely difficult and included topics that had not been taught. I may have gotten an A, but it took more hours than it was worth. Do not take this class,

Professor Valentin would make for a great neighbor, but he is not a good math teacher. He is so smart that it makes him poor for introducing ideas to beginners. His tests were extremely difficult, and sometimes included topics that had not been taught. I may have gotten an A, but it took more hours than it was worth. Do not take this class.

The class itself wasn't really that difficult. The only problem is that at the beginning he is hard to understand because he does have a string accent, but with time it does get easier to understand. The lectures are good and he works through every type of problem with all the steps. All the work is done through ALEKS, even tests.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Great professor. At the beginning of each unit he shows us how each of the new concepts are done step by step, before simplifying the equation to what we needed to know. His accent is a little difficult to understand, but he writes down everything we need to know. Each test has great study guides for them, and extra credit questions too.

Pedro seems like a nice and caring professor, but he does not know how to teach or structure his class. The test were extremely difficult and not comparable to the study guide. The bonus question was 1/6 of the study guide. Most of the class dropped this course. I do not recommend this teacher. Class averages have been sub 50 all semester.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: this is my first time ever writing an actual review for a teacher because this was probably the most individualized learning class i have ever took. Do not get me wrong the teacher is nice and all but he just does not know how to teach idk about other courses but calc was so bad. he uses terminology that he expects us to know and just goes too fast
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: TBF, he did say it was his first time teaching calc. extremely difficult study guides, even harder exams, the average of the first exam was around 40, then the 2nd exam average was lower. be prepared to teach yourself everything. Sets high expectations, but many fall short. About 70% of the class dropped.

While I believe this professor cares about what he's doing, and it feels bad to criticize him so harshly since this is his first year teaching calculus, I have to be honest. He teaches FAR too fast, jumps around from topic to topic constantly, and gives tests that are far harder than what is taught in class. Would not recommend.

I am not one to go about giving teachers bad reviews and never have but this is genuinely the worst teacher I have ever had. His tests are impossible and he does not understand how to teach Calc, 70% of our class has dropped not even 3 months in the class. He doesn't care about your grade at all. DO NOT TAKE.

He said before the first lecture that this was his first-time teaching Calculus and boy does it show. He has an extremely accelerated pace and has too much expectation. He doesn't understand that none of us understand the content. The review guides posted don't cover the right material at all
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things

comment: Worst class I have ever been in. He is very hard to understand. He believes learning is an individual process. He gives you nothing to study for exams. He absolutely doesn't know how to explain things. He does not care about your grade. I lost power one night during homework, and he basically said oh well. I do not recommend at all.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: His class is a joke u teach yourself for the exams. Also, he puts out a study guide that doesn't give the answers for it so it doesn't even really help. He also gives you only 4 attempts at homework problems so you cant even go back to review those as they cap out and just don't give u any new problems. if u don't master within a day u fail popquiz
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: Professor Jesus is not the best at speaking English, he is hard to understand. He is tough on grading. Lots of homework. Though the class isn't mandatory I would recommend going. I graduated high school with a 4.2 and aced calculus, yet failed this class. TAKE SOMEONE ELSE.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: If you arent an independent learner, dont take. He was a pretty good teacher, but you can learn everything through Aleks since the tests are all through aleks too. Hes very sweet and understands when you dont make it to a class. He allows you to retake tests you miss or deadlines for homework.

I don't think it matters who you professor is for Math1111, its hard and everyone uses Alek and you basically teach yourself most things. He lets you use a notecard on all test, including final. He's ok at explaining things he's a really nice guy. I got a 50 on the first test but after I actually did the hw I passed the class with a B.
This prof is a great person, but struggles with teaching. He is always willing to help, but gets confusing. If you don't understand algebra, I would be careful.

You can basically learn the whole course through the online site ALEKS, it teaches you all the lessons and there is weekly homework. You can use a notecard on the tests, and he offers extra credit. He has a pretty strong accent so understanding him sometimes is difficult. Overall, pretty simple math course if you actually want to put in the work.

He really does try his best but he is so difficult and dosent teach well. Aleks will last you 5 to 10 hours a week. Takes up so much time. Tests werent to bad, hes accessible outisde of class and responds to emails. I wouldnt take him again, he was not a good teacher.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Prof Pedro is a good person but not a good teacher. He makes everything more complicated than needed. I usually end up just teaching myself the material instead because its easier that way. There are 4 tests, hw once a week and test reflections. If you are already great at algebra take this class but DO NOT take him if you don't know what ur doing.

He's a great person but a horrible teacher. He's the type of math teacher that teaches everything a difficult way when there is a easier way to explain the problems. If you already took college Algebra before or are good at math, I recommend him since he only gives homework and tests and THAT'S ALL. If you are not confident in math DON'T TAKE HIM!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: This class was just overall tough, the workload is so heavy to where if you take too long trying to master one topic you miss out on the next 5. The professor is nice, but students have lives outside of class trying to make money just to live. A friend had to leave class early once for work and he was visibly annoyed. Pick another professor.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader
